meanings.definition: To surpass in action or performance.
meanings.sent1: She always tries to outact her classmates in the school play.
meanings.sent2: The athlete managed to outact his previous record in the race.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to outact the birds in gathering nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: The young musician outacted the experienced players with her violin skills.
meanings.sent5: The superhero outacted all the villains in the movie with his daring stunts.

meanings.definition: To outdo in behavior or conduct.
meanings.sent1: He tends to outact his friends in politeness and manners.
meanings.sent2: The dog tried to outact its mischievous behavior by wagging its tail.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkey outacted the zookeeper by stealing his hat.
meanings.sent4: The little girl outacted her shyness by confidently speaking in front of the class.
meanings.sent5: The magician outacted the audience's expectations with his amazing tricks.
